structure.unit: ARTICLE B. - STREET AND SIDEWALK STANDARDS

section.section: The street must be classified as residential street;
The street is existing and abutting property is substantially developed;
The street must serve a predominantly single family area; and
The street by actual count does not carry more than approximately fifteen hundred (1,500) vehicles per day.
Safety to pedestrians, vehicular movement, and abutting properties;
Collection of significant amounts of water from other streets;

Pedestrian generators (schools, office and shopping areas, bus routes, churches, etc.) and the availability of pedestrian walkways outside the public rights-of-way. In no event shall the travelled portion of the street be less than eighteen (18) feet (5.49 meters) in width.
Curb and gutter on one side and shoulder on the other side;
Pedestrian walkways on public property outside the street right-of-way. (Ord. No. 1987-69, ยง5, 10-20-87; Ord. No. 1999-619, ยง1, 8-3-99)
